section.title: Installation using Complete Binary Distribution
section.para: The latest Complete Binary Distribution contains:

section.title: Get the latest version
section.para: You can obtain the latest version of TorqueBox from the TorqueBox repository. As of this writing, the latest version is ${project.version}.

section.title: Unzip it somewhere handy
section.para: We'll install TorqueBox under your user's $HOME directory. The $JBOSS_HOME variable should be set to the path where JBoss is unpacked within the TorqueBox server.
Alternatively, you can set $JBOSS_HOME from your .bashrc or similar file

section.title: Ensure you have Java 6
section.para: To determine which version, if any, is installed on your system, at a command-line, attempt to run the java command with the -version argument.

screen.computeroutput: java version "1.6.0_07" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_07-b06-153) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.6.0_07-b06-57, mixed mode)

section.para: If the version is at least 1.6, you version of Java is sufficient.
If you have no Java installed, or a version less than 1.6, you'll need to install a Java Development Kit. For many systems, it is easy to install the open-source OpenJDK.
For installation on Ubuntu, Fedora, OpenSuse, or Debian, please refer to the installation instructions provided by the OpenJDK project.

section.title: Installing the TorqueBox deployer into an existing JBoss AS 5
section.para: To enable an existing JBoss AS5 installation for Ruby support, a single JAR file, the TorqueBox Deployer needs to be installed.

Before installing the TorqueBox Deployer into an existing JBoss AS, you need to ensure that JBoss is not running. Once the AS is stopped, follow the directions below to enable your AS to become Ruby-compatible.

listitem.para:
Locate the latest version of the TorqueBox Deployer JAR from the TorqueBox repository:
Official releases
Interim snapshot releases
Download the JAR with the name in the format of torquebox-core-${project.version}-deployer.jar.

Determine the location of your JBoss AS5 server and the configuration you plan to use. For clustering the all configuration is required. For non-clustering, the web or default configurations are acceptable.

The $JBOSS_HOME environment variable should be set to the top of your JBoss AS5 installation directory. By convention, the $JBOSS_CONF environment variable should contain the name of the configuration you are using.
Copy the deployer JAR into the deployers/ directory of the configuration.
